Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: In our view, the penalty after three years was of sufficient severity that the firm should have clearly informed Mr. B of the consequences. Furthermore, the firm did not follow its own obligations as outlined in the prospectus. We discussed the case with the firm and it agreed to compensate Mr. B $8,700 - an amount equal to what the client would have received had he elected to withdraw the funds soon after the account was put on "temporary termination". STRUCTURED INVESTMENT PRODUCTS On the suggestion of his advisor, Mr. V had purchased special "synthetic" preferred shares of a complex structured investment product designed to return capital at maturity. Its returns depended on the number of future credit defaults, or in other words, the level of net losses within the underlying portfolio. Shortly after purchasing the shares, an unexpected rise in credit defaults seriously impaired the viability of the product. Shareholders voted for early redemption, even with the knowledge that only a fraction of their investment could be recovered.
